title: Detect Cycle in Linked List
statement: Given a linked list, determine if it contains a cycle. The input provides the list and the position (0-indexed) where the tail connects to form a cycle. Position -1 means no cycle.
input_format:
First line contains N and POS (position where cycle connects, -1 if no cycle).
Second line contains N space-separated integers representing node values.
output_format: Print 'YES' if there is a cycle, otherwise 'NO'.
constraints:
0 <= N <= 10^4
-10^5 <= Node.val <= 10^5
POS is -1 or a valid index in the list.
